abstract: A.I.G. said Friday that it was in talks to sell a majority stake in its big aircraft leasing unit to a group led by several Chinese institutions.
snippet: A.I.G. said Friday that it was in talks to sell a majority stake in its big aircraft leasing unit to a group led by several Chinese institutions.
lead_paragraph: The American International Group said on Friday that it was in talks to sell a majority stake in its big aircraft leasing unit to a group led by several Chinese institutions. It would be another major asset sale by the bailed-out insurer, which is still paying off billions it received from the federal government.

headline.main: A.I.G. in Talks to Sell Control of Its Aircraft Leasing Unit
headline.print_headline: A.I.G. in Talks to Sell Control of Its Aircraft Leasing Unit

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
